name: Balaji Palanisamy
content: Balaji Palanisamy Associate Professor & Director of Graduate Studies Department of Informatics & Networked Systems School of Computing and Information Office: 135 N. Bellefield Avenue, Room 704 Pittsburgh, PA 15260 Email: bpalan@pitt(-dot--edu) Phone: 412.624.0232 CV I am an Associate Professor in the School of Computing and Information at the University of Pittsburgh. My research broadly spans the areas of Distributed Systems and Data Privacy. At Pitt, I carry out research in the Laboratory for Education and Research on Security Assured Information Systems (LERSAIS). I am also an Affiliate Scholar at the Institute for Cyber Law, Policy, and Security. Prior to joining the University of Pittsburgh, I received my Ph. D. degree in Computer Science from Georgia Institute of Technology. PhD positions: Were always looking for self-motivated and dedicated Ph.D students. If you are interested in joining our research group, please apply to our graduate program here. Research          Publications       Teaching         Contact RESEARCH INTERESTS: My research interest lies in the areas of Blockchains, Data Privacy, Privacy-aware Computing, Distributed Computer Systems, Edge Computing and Cloud Computing. I am especially interested in tackling problems related to scalable and privacy-conscious computing and data sharing in untrusted and outsourced computing environments.
